DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the extent of the surgical resection was confirmed radiographically.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._A radiographic procedure using the emission of x-rays to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation._Having been established or verified.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal or excision by surgical measures.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
